original: snga ma bzhin kta'o //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin kta'o //
translated: The former, kta.

original: hl'a d'i thung ngu'o //
analyzed: hl'a d'i thung ngu'o //
translated: The short hal.

original: nishtha @255a * //
analyzed: nishtha @255a * //
translated: Niṣṭhā.

original: smos pa sbrel bar bya'o //
analyzed: smos pa sbrel bar bya'o //
translated: The mention is to be connected.

original: de la don gyi dbang las bdun pa'i mtha' can du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de la don gyi dbang las bdun pa'i mtha' can du shes par bya'o //
translated: There, from the power of the meaning, it should be known to have the ending of the seventh.

original: hl'ad'i bde ba la'ang ngo zhes pa 'di'i nishth'a pha rol la thung ngur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: hl'ad'i bde ba la'ang ngo zhes pa 'di'i nishth'a pha rol la thung ngur 'gyur ro //
translated: The short of niṣṭhā becomes the other side of hal.

original: prahlanna:/ prahlanna w'an /
analyzed: prahlanna:/ prahlanna w'an /
translated: Prahlannaḥ, prahlannavānaḥ.

original: rab tu bde bar byas so zhes pas 'gro ba'i don dang las med pa zhes pas kta'o //
analyzed: rab tu bde bar byas so zhes pas 'gro ba'i don dang las med pa zhes pas kta'o //
translated: Prahlannaḥ means “he has made very happy.” Since there is no meaning of going, kta.

original: nishth'a'o zhes pas kta wantu'o //
analyzed: nishth'a'o zhes pas kta wantu'o //
translated: Niṣṭhā means ktavan.

original: di shve zhes pas aita med do //
analyzed: di shve zhes pas aita med do //
translated: Diśve means “there is not.”

original: 'dis thung ngu'o //🔽da las snga ma'i da'i 'ang ngo zhes pas nishtha na nyid de /
analyzed: 'dis thung ngu'o // da las snga ma'i da'i 'ang ngo zhes pas nishtha na nyid de /
translated: This is the short.🔽The former da of da is also.

original: snga ma'i da'i 'ang na'o //
analyzed: snga ma'i da'i 'ang na'o //
translated: Niṣṭhā is also the former da.

original: nishth'a la zhes pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: nishth'a la zhes pa ci zhe na /
translated: What is niṣṭhā?

original: a'ahl'a da ya ti //
analyzed: a'ahl'a da ya ti //
translated: Āhlādya.

original: kun nas bde bar byed pa la rab tu sbyor ro zhes pas aina'o //
analyzed: kun nas bde bar byed pa la rab tu sbyor ro zhes pas aina'o //
translated: Prahlādanayogena means “he is engaged in the cause of complete happiness.”

original: kti'i rkyen la'ang 'dod de /
analyzed: kti'i rkyen la'ang 'dod de /
translated: It is also asserted as the condition of kta.🔽Prahlattaḥ.

original: prahlatti:/ dngos po'i don la bud med la kti'o ;
analyzed: prahlatti:/ dngos po'i don la bud med la kti'o ;
translated: In the meaning of a thing, kta is for a woman.

original: / tsh'a di'i gha ais mantran kvi pa rnams la'ang ngo //
analyzed: / tsh'a di'i gha ais mantran kvi pa rnams la'ang ngo //
translated: And also to the kavipa, the poets.

original: tsh'a di'i ghal ste /
analyzed: tsh'a di'i ghal ste /
translated: The sadi is the gha.

original: nyer bsgyur gnyis med pi'i'o //
analyzed: nyer bsgyur gnyis med pi'i'o //
translated: The two indeclinables are not.

original: tsh'ad yang dag par sgrib pa la'o zhes pa 'di'i gha'i rkyen pha rol la thung dur 'gyur te /
analyzed: tsh'ad yang dag par sgrib pa la'o zhes pa 'di'i gha'i rkyen pha rol la thung dur 'gyur te /
translated: Sadi means to cover. The gha of this is shortened in the case of the other.

original: nyer bsgyur gnyis pa'i ni mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyer bsgyur gnyis pa'i ni mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The second indeclinable is not.

original: pratstsha da:/ danta tstsha da:/
analyzed: pratstsha da:/ danta tstsha da:/
translated: Pracchat, dantacchat.

original: tsh'a di ni tsur la sogs pa nyid kyi phyir aina'i mtha' can no ;
analyzed: tsh'a di ni tsur la sogs pa nyid kyi phyir aina'i mtha' can no ;
translated: Sadi has the ending of in because of the cur etc.

original: /'dis so rnams sgrib par byed do zhes pas skyes pa la ming la gha'o //
analyzed: /'dis so rnams sgrib par byed do zhes pas skyes pa la ming la gha'o //
translated: By this, the teeth are covered. Therefore, in the masculine, the name is gha.

original: gha yig ni tsa dza dag gi ka dag gi ka dag go zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: gha yig ni tsa dza dag gi ka dag gi ka dag go zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The letter gha is the ka of the ca and ja.

original: thung ngu'o // k'a ri ta dbyi'o //
analyzed: thung ngu'o // k'a ri ta dbyi'o //
translated: It is short. The kari is the mouth.

original: nyer bsgyur gnyis pa min pa'i zhes pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: nyer bsgyur gnyis pa min pa'i zhes pa ci zhe na /
translated: What is the second indeclinable?

original: sa mu patstsha da:/
analyzed: sa mu patstsha da:/
translated: Samucchat.

original: snga ma bzhin du gha'o //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du gha'o //
translated: As before, it is gha.

original: nyer bsgyur du ma can gyi tsh'a di'ang thung ngur 'dod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: nyer bsgyur du ma can gyi tsh'a di'ang thung ngur 'dod pa ma yin te /
translated: The sadi with many indeclinables is also not accepted as short.

original: sa mu bhi tstsha da:/
analyzed: sa mu bhi tstsha da:/
translated: Samubhicchat.

original: ai sa mantran kvi pa rnams la'ang ngo //
analyzed: ai sa mantran kvi pa rnams la'ang ngo //
translated: The same is true of the words īsamantaka, kṛpāṇa,

original: nyer bsgyur gnyis pa can min pa'i zhes pa ldog go //
analyzed: nyer bsgyur gnyis pa can min pa'i zhes pa ldog go //
translated: and the words that do not have a second prefix.

original: ais dang man dang tra dang kvipa ste 'di rnams pha rol la tsh'a di'i thung ngur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ais dang man dang tra dang kvipa ste 'di rnams pha rol la tsh'a di'i thung ngur 'gyur ro //
translated: The words īs, man, tra, and kṛpāṇa become cāḍhi in the dative.🔽The word īs is

original: ais ni / tstsha di;/
analyzed: ais ni / tstsha di;/
translated: cāḍhi.

original: 'dis 'gegs par byed do zhes pas /
analyzed: 'dis 'gegs par byed do zhes pas /
translated: It is said, “This one obstructs.”

original: aar tstshi shu tsi hu sri pratstsha ditstsham di rnams las aisa'o zhes pas aisa'o ;
analyzed: aar tstshi shu tsi hu sri pratstsha ditstsham di rnams las aisa'o zhes pas aisa'o ;
translated: From the words arciṣ, ciṣ, huṣ, śrī, pracāḍhi, and pracāḍhi, it is īs.

original: / k'a ri ta dbyi'ko //
analyzed: / k'a ri ta dbyi'ko //
translated: The word kṛpāṇa is🔽kṛpāṇa.

original: thung ngu'o // man ni /
analyzed: thung ngu'o // man ni /
translated: It is short. The word man is

original: tstshadm'a / tstsha di las mna'o //
analyzed: tstshadm'a / tstsha di las mna'o //
translated: cāḍham.

original: zhes pas mna'o /
analyzed: zhes pas mna'o /
translated: It is said, “From cāḍhi, it is man.”

original: tra ni / tstshattra /
analyzed: tra ni / tstshattra /
translated: The word tra is🔽cāḍhatra.

original: shana'o zhes pas shtana'o //
analyzed: shana'o zhes pas shtana'o //
translated: It is said, “From cāḍhi, it is tra.”

original: sha yig ni a'i yig gi don to //
analyzed: sha yig ni a'i yig gi don to //
translated: The letter śa is the meaning of the letter ā.

original: mdor tre'i sgras brjod pa las sha nyid log pa na ta nyid ldog go //
analyzed: mdor tre'i sgras brjod pa las sha nyid log pa na ta nyid ldog go //
translated: In brief, from the expression cāḍha, when śa itself is negated, ta itself is negated.🔽The word kṛpāṇa is

original: kvipa ni // gri ha tstsha tra /
analyzed: kvipa ni // gri ha tstsha tra /
translated: grīhacāḍha.

original: khang pa sgrib par byed do zhes pas kvipa'o //
analyzed: khang pa sgrib par byed do zhes pas kvipa'o //
translated: It is said, “A house obstructs.” Therefore it is kṛpāṇa.

original: ring po nye ba'i tshig mi zad pa min pa'i kha rjes su 'brel ba la'o //
analyzed: ring po nye ba'i tshig mi zad pa min pa'i kha rjes su 'brel ba la'o //
translated: The long vowel is connected with the suffix.

original: nye ba'i tshig mi zad pa min pa'i ste mi zad pa dang bral ba'i ring po'i mtha' kha rjes su 'brel pa'i rkyen yod pa thung ngur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nye ba'i tshig mi zad pa min pa'i ste mi zad pa dang bral ba'i ring po'i mtha' kha rjes su 'brel pa'i rkyen yod pa thung ngur 'gyur ro //
translated: The short vowel is connected with the suffix, which is not an indeclinable.

original: sa tim man+ya ku la t'a /
analyzed: sa tim man+ya ku la t'a /
translated: satim manyakula tā

original: t'a ru n'im man+y'as briddh'a /
analyzed: t'a ru n'im man+y'as briddh'a /
translated: tāruṇīm manyāsā bṛddhā

original: man shes pa la'o //
analyzed: man shes pa la'o //
translated: manasā

original: sa t'i dang ta ru n'i'i sgra dag snga mar ro //
analyzed: sa t'i dang ta ru n'i'i sgra dag snga mar ro //
translated: The words satī and tāruṇī are in the first case.

original: dam pa mor @255b bdag nyid sems so //
analyzed: dam pa mor @255b bdag nyid sems so //
translated: I think of myself as a good woman.

original: gzhon nu mar bdag nyid sems so //
analyzed: gzhon nu mar bdag nyid sems so //
translated: I think of myself as a young woman.

original: zhes pas bdag nyid la kha sha'ang ngo //
analyzed: zhes pas bdag nyid la kha sha'ang ngo //
translated: Thus, the word kham is also in the mouth.

original: sha yig ni sha la byings thams cad pa bzhin zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: sha yig ni sha la byings thams cad pa bzhin zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The letter kha has the meaning of all the roots.

original: kha yig ni 'di'i don to //
analyzed: kha yig ni 'di'i don to //
translated: The letter kha has this meaning.

original: di ba sogs pa las yana'o //🔽bud med la aa las a'a pa'o nye ba'i tshig gi thung ngu'o //
analyzed: di ba sogs pa las yana'o // bud med la aa las a'a pa'o nye ba'i tshig gi thung ngu'o //
translated: From diva and so on, yati.🔽In the feminine, from a, ā. The short vowel is a suffix.

original: thung ngu dang aa ru sha dag gi zhes pas ma a'a ga ma'o //
analyzed: thung ngu dang aa ru sha dag gi zhes pas ma a'a ga ma'o //
translated: From short and a, ruśa, and so on, āgamā.

original: mi zad pa min pa'i zhes pa ci zhe na /🔽di w'a man+y'a r'a tv'a:/
analyzed: mi zad pa min pa'i zhes pa ci zhe na / di w'a man+y'a r'a tv'a:/

original: do sh'a man+y'a ma h'a:/
analyzed: do sh'a man+y'a ma h'a:/
translated: doṣāmahe

original: ma na shes pa la'o //
analyzed: ma na shes pa la'o //
translated: manasā

original: di w'a dang do sh'a'i sgra dag snga mar ro //🔽nyin mo bzhin du bdag nyid sems so //
analyzed: di w'a dang do sh'a'i sgra dag snga mar ro // nyin mo bzhin du bdag nyid sems so //
translated: The words divā and doṣā are in the first case.🔽One thinks of oneself as if it were day.

original: do sh'a dang 'dra bar bdag nyid sems so zhes pas snga ma bzhin du kha sha'o //
analyzed: do sh'a dang 'dra bar bdag nyid sems so zhes pas snga ma bzhin du kha sha'o //
translated: One thinks of oneself as if it were night.

original: kha rjes su 'brel pa la zhes pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: kha rjes su 'brel pa la zhes pa ci zhe na /
translated: What is meant by “after”?

original: ba dhum ma n+ya te /
analyzed: ba dhum ma n+ya te /
translated: badhumanye

original: dbyangs gcig pa'i n'a mi'i aam ste rkyen bzhin 'ang ngo //
analyzed: dbyangs gcig pa'i n'a mi'i aam ste rkyen bzhin 'ang ngo //
translated: The single vowel nāmin is am, like a condition.

original: nye ba'i tshig mi zad pa min pa'i zhes pa dang kha rjes su 'brel pa la zhes pa 'dir rjes su 'jug go //
analyzed: nye ba'i tshig mi zad pa min pa'i zhes pa dang kha rjes su 'brel pa la zhes pa 'dir rjes su 'jug go //
translated: The near word “not imperishable” and “after” are added here.

original: phyi ma la yang ngo //
analyzed: phyi ma la yang ngo //
translated: It is also in the next.

analyzed: n'a mi'i mtha' can gyi nye ba'i tshig mi zad pa min pa dbyangs gcig pa'i kha rjes su 'brel pa yod na /
translated: When there is a near word ending in nāmin, not imperishable, and single vowel, after,

original: aam a'a ga ma 'gyur te de'ang rkyen bzhin no //
analyzed: aam a'a ga ma 'gyur te de'ang rkyen bzhin no //
translated: am ā becomes āgama, and that is like a condition.

original: 'o na rkyen ji bzhin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na rkyen ji bzhin zhe na /

original: brjod par bya ste aam dang nye ba'i rkyen smos pas aam gyi rkyen kho na rtogs par bya'i rkyen gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: brjod par bya ste aam dang nye ba'i rkyen smos pas aam gyi rkyen kho na rtogs par bya'i rkyen gzhan ni ma yin no //

original: de lta'ang ci zhig gi aam 'dzin zhe na /
analyzed: de lta'ang ci zhig gi aam 'dzin zhe na /

original: gnyis pa gcig tshig go //
analyzed: gnyis pa gcig tshig go //

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /

original: bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bshad pa'i phyir ro //

original: yang 'di a'aga mar 'gyur ro zhes ji ltar bshad par bya zhe na /
analyzed: yang 'di a'aga mar 'gyur ro zhes ji ltar bshad par bya zhe na /
translated: Moreover, how is this to be explained as am?

original: brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: brjod par bya ste /
translated: We reply:

original: rkyen dang 'dra bar bsgre ba'i shugs la ste /
analyzed: rkyen dang 'dra bar bsgre ba'i shugs la ste /

analyzed: gang gi phyir gal te 'di bsgyur ba yin par gyur na rkyen dang 'dra ba'i 'bras bu ci zhig tu 'gyur /
translated: Because if this were a transformation, what would be the result that is like the condition?🔽ga, ma, nya,🔽sti, ma, nya,🔽śrī, ya, ma, nya,

analyzed: g'am ma n+ya:/ stim ma n+ya:/ shri yam ma n+ya:/

analyzed: bhu wam ma n+ya:/

original: nam ra ma n+ya:/
analyzed: nam ra ma n+ya:/

analyzed: man shes pa la'o // go / st'i /

analyzed: shri / bhu nri zhes pa snga ma'o //🔽rdo rje bdag nyid sems par byad do zhes pa la sogs par tshig rnam par sbyor /

original: snga ma bzhin du kha sha'o //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du kha sha'o //

original: aam a'a ga ma'o //
analyzed: aam a'a ga ma'o //

original: rkyen dang 'dra bar 'gyur ba'i phyir aam shas dag la a'a'o //
analyzed: rkyen dang 'dra bar 'gyur ba'i phyir aam shas dag la a'a'o //

original: aam shas dag gi dang po dbyi'o //
analyzed: aam shas dag gi dang po dbyi'o //

original: a'ita a'uta dag gi ai ya auwa dag dbyangs la'o //
analyzed: a'ita a'uta dag gi ai ya auwa dag dbyangs la'o //

original: ghut la'o zhes pas rit kyi cho ga rnams 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ghut la'o zhes pas rit kyi cho ga rnams 'gyur ro //
translated: Because of ghuṭa la, the rules of ṛt are changed.🔽What is nāmi?

original: n'a m'i'i zhes pa ci zhe na /🔽dznyam ma n+y'a /
analyzed: n'a m'i'i zhes pa ci zhe na / dznyam ma n+y'a /

original: shes par byed do zhes pas dznya ste n'a min au pa dh'a dang pr'i kr'i gr'i dznya rnams kyi ka'o //
analyzed: shes par byed do zhes pas dznya ste n'a min au pa dh'a dang pr'i kr'i gr'i dznya rnams kyi ka'o //
translated: Because of it causes knowledge, it is jña. Because of nāmin aupādapṛkṛijñā, the ka of jña is changed.

original: zhes pas ka'i rkyen no //
analyzed: zhes pas ka'i rkyen no //
translated: Because of it is a condition, it is ka.

original: shes par bdag nyid sems so zhes pas kha sha'o //
analyzed: shes par bdag nyid sems so zhes pas kha sha'o //
translated: Because of the self thinks knowledge, it is khaśa.

original: ring po nye ba'i tshig gi zhes pas dzny'a'i sgra'i thung ngu'o //
analyzed: ring po nye ba'i tshig gi zhes pas dzny'a'i sgra'i thung ngu'o //
translated: Because of long, near, word, the short of the word jña is changed.

original: thung ngu dang aa ru sha dag gi zhes pas ma a'a ga ma'o //
analyzed: thung ngu dang aa ru sha dag gi zhes pas ma a'a ga ma'o //
translated: Because of short and am ā, it is ma āgama.

original: gal te aam a'a ga ma @256a * //
analyzed: gal te aam a'a ga ma @256a * //
translated: If it is am āgama,

original: 'gyur na thung ngur mi 'gyur bar thal te /
analyzed: 'gyur na thung ngur mi 'gyur bar thal te /

original: thung ngu'i a'a ga ma bkag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thung ngu'i a'a ga ma bkag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the short āgama is prohibited.

original: dbyangs gcig pa'i zhes pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: dbyangs gcig pa'i zhes pa ci zhe na /
translated: What is the one-syllable?

original: se n'a ni ma n+ya:/
analyzed: se n'a ni ma n+ya:/
translated: Sena-mani.

original: dmag dpon du bdag nyid sems par byed do zhes pas kha sha'o //
analyzed: dmag dpon du bdag nyid sems par byed do zhes pas kha sha'o //
translated: I think of myself as a general. Thus, ksha.

original: snga ma bzhin du thung ngu dang ma a'a ga ma'ang ngo //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du thung ngu dang ma a'a ga ma'ang ngo //
translated: As before, short and ma-aga.

original: mi zad pa min pa'i zhes pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: mi zad pa min pa'i zhes pa ci zhe na /
translated: What is not-inexhaustible?🔽Sumani.

original: su ma n+ya: mdzes par bdag nyid sems so zhes pas kha sha'o //
analyzed: su ma n+ya: mdzes par bdag nyid sems so zhes pas kha sha'o //
translated: I think of myself as beautiful. Thus, ksha.

original: thung ngu dang aa ru sha dag gi mtha'o //
analyzed: thung ngu dang aa ru sha dag gi mtha'o //
translated: At the end of short and arusha.

original: thung ngu dang aa ru sha ni de dag ste thung ngu dang aa ru sha dag go //
analyzed: thung ngu dang aa ru sha ni de dag ste thung ngu dang aa ru sha dag go //
translated: Short and arusha are those two, short and arusha.

original: thung ngu'i mtha' can nye ba'i tshig zad pa ma yin pa dang / aa ru sha'i sgra'i kha rjes su 'brel par gyur pa la ma yig a'a ga mar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thung ngu'i mtha' can nye ba'i tshig zad pa ma yin pa dang / aa ru sha'i sgra'i kha rjes su 'brel par gyur pa la ma yig a'a ga mar 'gyur ro //
translated: The suffix ending in short is not exhausted, and the letter ma becomes agama in connection with the sound arusha.

original: mtha'i sgra ni a'a ga ma nyid du gsal bar byed do zhes gsung ngo //
analyzed: mtha'i sgra ni a'a ga ma nyid du gsal bar byed do zhes gsung ngo //
translated: The final sound is clarified as agama itself, it is said.🔽Stanandhaya.

original: sta nandha ya:/ a'a syamdha ya:/
analyzed: sta nandha ya:/ a'a syamdha ya:/
translated: Asyandhaya.

original: dhet 'thung ba la'o //
analyzed: dhet 'thung ba la'o //
translated: Deta means to drink.

original: sta na dang a'a sya dag snga ma'o //
analyzed: sta na dang a'a sya dag snga ma'o //
translated: Stana and asya are the former.

original: nu ma las 'thung ngo zhes pa shu ni stan munydza zhes pas kha sha'o //
analyzed: nu ma las 'thung ngo zhes pa shu ni stan munydza zhes pas kha sha'o //
translated: The word suta means to drink and is from the root su with the affix tamuñja.

original: aan bi ka ra na'o //🔽ae aa ya'o //
analyzed: aan bi ka ra na'o // ae aa ya'o //
translated: The word anabhikaraṇa means not to be done and is from the root anabhi with the affix karaṇa.

original: aa dang mtshams sbyor gyi yi ge dbyi'o //
analyzed: aa dang mtshams sbyor gyi yi ge dbyi'o //
translated: The word eka means one and is from the root i with the affix a.

original: 'dis ma a'a ga ma'o //
analyzed: 'dis ma a'a ga ma'o //

original: aa runtu da:/ tud brdung ba la'o//
analyzed: aa runtu da:/ tud brdung ba la'o//
translated: The word aruntud means to beat and is from the root aru with the affix tud.

original: aa ru sha snga mar ro //
analyzed: aa ru sha snga mar ro //
translated: The word arusa is the same as the previous.

original: aa ru sha brdung ngo zhes pa ba ha bi dhu aa rus ti la rnams la tud las so zhes pas kha sha'o //
analyzed: aa ru sha brdung ngo zhes pa ba ha bi dhu aa rus ti la rnams la tud las so zhes pas kha sha'o //
translated: The word arusa-tuda means to beat arusa and is from the root arusa with the affix tud.

original: aan bi ka ra na'o //
analyzed: aan bi ka ra na'o //
translated: The word anabhikaraṇa means not to be done and is from the root anabhi with the affix karaṇa.

original: ma a'a ga ma'o //
analyzed: ma a'a ga ma'o //
translated: The word agāma means has come and is from the root gam with the affix a.

original: brtsegs pa dang po'i dhut'i'o zhes pas sa yig dbyi'o //
analyzed: brtsegs pa dang po'i dhut'i'o zhes pas sa yig dbyi'o //
translated: The word dhuti means heap and is from the root dhū with the affix ti.

original: mi zad pa min pa'i zhes ba ci zhe na /
analyzed: mi zad pa min pa'i zhes ba ci zhe na /
translated: What is meant by not imperishable?

original: su ka ra:/ bde mor byas so zhes pas a'ishad dur su rnams la zhes pas kha la'o //
analyzed: su ka ra:/ bde mor byas so zhes pas a'ishad dur su rnams la zhes pas kha la'o //
translated: The word sukṛtaḥ means well done and is from the root su with the affix kṛta.

original: la yig ni dngos po dang las dag la kri tya kta zhes pa'i don no //
analyzed: la yig ni dngos po dang las dag la kri tya kta zhes pa'i don no //
translated: The letter la means kṛtya and kṛti in the sense of object and action.

original: kha yig ni ring po'i nye ba'i tshig ces pa'i don no //
analyzed: kha yig ni ring po'i nye ba'i tshig ces pa'i don no //
translated: The letter kha means long in the sense of a derivative.

original: aushna dang bha dra dag gi ka ra na'i sgra pha rol la ma a'a ga mar bshad par bya'o //🔽aunam ka ra nam /
analyzed: aushna dang bha dra dag gi ka ra na'i sgra pha rol la ma a'a ga mar bshad par bya'o // aunam ka ra nam /
translated: The karaṇa of oṣaṇa and bhadram should be explained as the āgama of the other, ma.🔽unam karaṇam

original: bha ram ka nam /
analyzed: bha ram ka nam /
translated: bharam karaṇam

original: sa tya dang a'a ga da dang aa stu rnams kyi k'a ra la'o //
analyzed: sa tya dang a'a ga da dang aa stu rnams kyi k'a ra la'o //

original: satya a'a ga ta aastu ste de rnams ni satya dang a'a ga dang aastu rnams te /
analyzed: satya a'a ga ta aastu ste de rnams ni satya dang a'a ga dang aastu rnams te /
translated: Satya, āgata, and astu. These are satya, āga, and astu.

original: satya dang a'a ga dang aastu zhes pa 'di rnams kyi k'a ra'i sgra pha rol lam yig a'a ga ma 'gyur ro //
analyzed: satya dang a'a ga dang aastu zhes pa 'di rnams kyi k'a ra'i sgra pha rol lam yig a'a ga ma 'gyur ro //
translated: The kara of these, satya, āga, and astu, becomes the āgama of the other, ma.🔽satyaṃ karaḥ🔽āgadam karaḥ

original: satyam k'ar:/ aa gdam k'ar:/
analyzed: satyam k'ar:/ aa gdam k'ar:/
translated: astum karaḥ

original: aastum k'ar:/ bden par byed do /
analyzed: aastum k'ar:/ bden par byed do /

original: dpung rgyan byed do //
analyzed: dpung rgyan byed do //

original: aastu byed do zhes pas las la aana'o //
analyzed: aastu byed do zhes pas las la aana'o //
translated: One makes an asti. Thus, the an is added to the verbal root.

original: ma a'a ga ma'o aastu'i sgra tshig phrad du khas blangs pa na 'jug go //
analyzed: ma a'a ga ma'o aastu'i sgra tshig phrad du khas blangs pa na 'jug go //

original: gil ma gi la min pa'i'o //
analyzed: gil ma gi la min pa'i'o //
translated: It is not like gil and mila.

original: nye ba'i tshig mi zad pa min pa'i zhes 'jug ste thung ngu smos pa 'ang ngo //
analyzed: nye ba'i tshig mi zad pa min pa'i zhes 'jug ste thung ngu smos pa 'ang ngo //
translated: The near word is not akṣara. It is used with a short vowel.

original: nye ba'i tshig mi zad pa min pa thung ngu'i mtha' can gyi la min pa ste ki la'i sgra bor ba'i ma yig a'a ga mar 'gyur te /
analyzed: nye ba'i tshig mi zad pa min pa thung ngu'i mtha' can gyi la min pa ste ki la'i sgra bor ba'i ma yig a'a ga mar 'gyur te /
translated: The proximate word is not akṣara, but the one ending in short a, namely la, with the sound of ki dropped, the original letter is ā.

original: gi la'i skra pha rol la'o //🔽ti mim gi la:/🔽sha trum gi la:/
analyzed: gi la'i skra pha rol la'o // ti mim gi la:/ sha trum gi la:/
translated: The hair of the enemy is suppressed.🔽The enemy is suppressed.

original: bri nges par @256b gnon pa la'o //
analyzed: bri nges par @256b gnon pa la'o //

original: ti mi dang sha tru'i sgra dag snga ma'o //
analyzed: ti mi dang sha tru'i sgra dag snga ma'o //

original: chu srin gnon no //
analyzed: chu srin gnon no //

original: dgra bo gnon no zhes pas /
analyzed: dgra bo gnon no zhes pas /

original: mu lar bi bhudza la sogs pa rnams las kyang ngo zhes pas ka'o //
analyzed: mu lar bi bhudza la sogs pa rnams las kyang ngo zhes pas ka'o //
translated: Also from words such as mulāvibhuja, it is ka.

original: r'i ta mtha'i aira'o //
analyzed: r'i ta mtha'i aira'o //

original: dbyangs la yang na'o zhes pas la nyid do //
analyzed: dbyangs la yang na'o zhes pas la nyid do //
translated: Also on the vowel, it is na. Thus it is la itself.

original: 'dis ma a'a ga ma'o //
analyzed: 'dis ma a'a ga ma'o //

original: mi zad pa min pa'i zhes pa ci zhen /
analyzed: mi zad pa min pa'i zhes pa ci zhen /

original: ni gi la:/ nges par gnon to zhes pa n'a ma'i au pa dh'a dang pri kri gri zhes pas ka'o //
analyzed: ni gi la:/ nges par gnon to zhes pa n'a ma'i au pa dh'a dang pri kri gri zhes pas ka'o //

original: thung ngu mtha' can gyi zhes pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: thung ngu mtha' can gyi zhes pa ci zhe na /
translated: What is meant by ending in short a?

original: ta da gil:/ de gnon to zhes pa ma'u la bi bhu dza la sogs pa nyid kyi phyir ka'o //
analyzed: ta da gil:/ de gnon to zhes pa ma'u la bi bhu dza la sogs pa nyid kyi phyir ka'o //

analyzed: gi la ma yin pa'i zhes pa ci zhe na / gi la gi la:/ gi la gnon no zhes pas snga ma bzhin ka'o //

original: don dang ldan pa'i gi la'i sgra gzung ba ste /
analyzed: don dang ldan pa'i gi la'i sgra gzung ba ste /

original: des na don med pa can la mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na don med pa can la mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it does not apply to that which is without meaning.

original: ma dhu li ha ti /
analyzed: ma dhu li ha ti /

translated: The word kṛtvā is used in the sense of kṛtvā in the expression kṛtvā kṛtvā and so on.

analyzed: a'i shat su ngur rnams la zhes pas khala'o //🔽'dis ma a'a ga ma'o //
translated: The word kṛtvā is used in the sense of kṛtvā in the expression kṛtvā kṛtvā and so on.🔽The word kṛtvā is used in the sense of kṛtvā in the expression kṛtvā kṛtvā and so on.🔽The word kṛtvā is used in the sense of kṛtvā in the expression kṛtvā kṛtvā and so on.🔽The word kṛtvā is used in the sense of kṛtvā in the expression kṛtvā kṛtvā and so on.🔽The word kṛtvā is used in the sense of kṛtvā in the expression kṛtvā kṛtvā and so on.🔽The word kṛtvā is used in the sense of kṛtvā in the expression kṛtvā kṛtvā and so on.

original: ghanya la / au pa lam bha:/
analyzed: ghanya la / au pa lam bha:/
translated: Gnya🔽la, upa-lambha.

original: la bhi las dngos po la ghanya'o //
analyzed: la bhi las dngos po la ghanya'o //
translated: From la-bha, thing, gnya.

original: nyer bsgyur las zhes pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: nyer bsgyur las zhes pa ci zhe na /
translated: What is meant by from a prefix?🔽Ai🔽shalla-bha.

original: aa'ishall bha:/ bde blag tu thob par byed do zhes pas snga ma bzhin du khala'o //
analyzed: aa'ishall bha:/ bde blag tu thob par byed do zhes pas snga ma bzhin du khala'o //
translated: It is obtained easily, so it is khya as before.

original: 'o na 'dir ra bhi la bha zhes pa 'dis na a'a ga ma ci'i phyir mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na 'dir ra bhi la bha zhes pa 'dis na a'a ga ma ci'i phyir mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: But here, what is this ra-bha? Why is it not na-a-ga-ma?

original: brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: brjod par bya ste /
translated: It is said:

original: gal te 'gyur na la bha zhes pa'i gzugs 'bras bu las yang dag par 'byung ba nyid kyi phyir nyer bsgyur smos pas ci zhig byas par 'gyur /
analyzed: gal te 'gyur na la bha zhes pa'i gzugs 'bras bu las yang dag par 'byung ba nyid kyi phyir nyer bsgyur smos pas ci zhig byas par 'gyur /
translated: If it were, then because the form la-bha would be the result of the correct arising, what would be the use of mentioning the prefix?

original: su dur dag min pa las zhes pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: su dur dag min pa las zhes pa ci zhe na /
translated: What is meant by not from su-du-ra?

original: su la bha: du rla bha:/🔽khala'o // gal te de bzhin yin na ji ltar /
analyzed: su la bha: du rla bha:/ khala'o // gal te de bzhin yin na ji ltar /
translated: Su-la-bha, du-ra-bha.🔽Khya.🔽If it is like that, then how is it that su-pra-la-bha, du-shpra-la-bha?

original: su pra lam bha: dushpra lam bha: yin zhe na brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: su pra lam bha: dushpra lam bha: yin zhe na brjod par bya ste /
translated: It is said:

original: 'dir ni su dur dag las pha rol gyi la bhi min no //
analyzed: 'dir ni su dur dag las pha rol gyi la bhi min no //
translated: Here, it is not the la-bha of the other from su-du-ra.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: But what is it?

original: pra'i sgra las te /
analyzed: pra'i sgra las te /
translated: It is from the word pra.

original: su dur 'ba' zhig pa dag las dgag bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: su dur 'ba' zhig pa dag las dgag bshad par bya'o //
translated: We will explain the refutation of the Sāṃkhya from the🔽Sūtra on the Wise and the Foolish.🔽Thus,

original: des na / aa ti su lam bha: aa ti du rlam bha:/
analyzed: des na / aa ti su lam bha: aa ti du rlam bha:/
translated: ati-sul-labha, ati-dur-labha.

original: gal te de bzhin ci ltar na ci ltar /🔽aa ti su la bham /
analyzed: gal te de bzhin ci ltar na ci ltar / aa ti su la bham /
translated: If it is so, then how is it?🔽Ati-sul-labha.

original: aa ti durla bham /
analyzed: aa ti durla bham /
translated: Ati-dur-labha.

original: zhes pa yin zhe na brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: zhes pa yin zhe na brjod par bya ste /
translated: If it is asked what is this, it should be said:

original: su la bha dang dur la bha'i sgra dag 'dus byas nas phyi nas aa ti'i sgra dang 'brel ba'o //
analyzed: su la bha dang dur la bha'i sgra dag 'dus byas nas phyi nas aa ti'i sgra dang 'brel ba'o //
translated: The words sul-labha and dur-labha are compounded, and then the word ati is connected.

original: phul du byung bas rnyed par sla ba ni /
analyzed: phul du byung bas rnyed par sla ba ni /
translated: That which is easy to obtain by excellence is

original: aa ti su la bham /
analyzed: aa ti su la bham /
translated: ati-sul-labha.

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: Similarly,

original: aa ti du rla bham /
analyzed: aa ti du rla bham /
translated: ati-dur-labha.

original: a'ang las pha rol gyi la bhi las ya yig dang po can gyi rkyen la ma yig a'a ga ma bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: a'ang las pha rol gyi la bhi las ya yig dang po can gyi rkyen la ma yig a'a ga ma bshad par bya ste /
translated: Also, from the word a, from the parārtha of labhi, the first ya-vowel is the condition, and the a-vowel is explained as coming after.🔽Alabhyate.

original: a'a lam bhya:/ kun nas thob @257a * //
analyzed: a'a lam bhya:/ kun nas thob @257a * //
translated: It is to be obtained all around.

original: par bya'o zhes pa sha ki sa hi pa sde mtha' las kyang po zhes pas ya'o //
analyzed: par bya'o zhes pa sha ki sa hi pa sde mtha' las kyang po zhes pas ya'o //
translated: From the last part of the word śakyate, the ya is from the first.

original: yan dang tse kri yi ta dag la'ang mi 'dod de /🔽a'a la bhya te /
analyzed: yan dang tse kri yi ta dag la'ang mi 'dod de / a'a la bhya te /
translated: It is also not desired for the words a, la, and bhyate.🔽Alabhyate.

original: a'a la la bhya te /
analyzed: a'a la la bhya te /
translated: Alabhyate.

original: shin tu kun du thob par bya'o zhes pas ya sgra'o //
analyzed: shin tu kun du thob par bya'o zhes pas ya sgra'o //
translated: The ya sound is from the word yāsyāmi, “I will go.”

original: r'a ti las krit la yang na'o //
analyzed: r'a ti las krit la yang na'o //
translated: The na sound is from kṛta, “done.”

original: ra tri'i sgra'i rkyen yod pa na ma yig a'a ga mang yang na 'gyur ro //🔽r'a tri tsa ra:/
analyzed: ra tri'i sgra'i rkyen yod pa na ma yig a'a ga mang yang na 'gyur ro // r'a tri tsa ra:/
translated: When there is the condition of the word rātri, the ma sound becomes ya, or it becomes na.🔽Rātri-carah.

original: r'a ti tsa ra:/
analyzed: r'a ti tsa ra:/
translated: Rātri-carah.

original: mtshan mo rgyu bar byed do zhes pas tsa ri las ta'o //
analyzed: mtshan mo rgyu bar byed do zhes pas tsa ri las ta'o //
translated: The ca sound is from cari, “to go,” and the ra is from rātri.

original: ra tr'i ma ta:/
analyzed: ra tr'i ma ta:/
translated: Rātri-matah.🔽Rātry-ātaḥ.🔽The ta sound is from car, “to go,” and the ra is from rātri.

original: r'a trya ta:/ mtshan mo 'gro'o zhes pas btsa sogs rnams las aats'o zhes pas aatsa'o //
analyzed: r'a trya ta:/ mtshan mo 'gro'o zhes pas btsa sogs rnams las aats'o zhes pas aatsa'o //
translated: The ṭa sound is from ṭa, etc.

original: krit la zhes pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: krit la zhes pa ci zhe na /
translated: What is meant by kṛta?

original: r'a tri g'a ra gya:/
analyzed: r'a tri g'a ra gya:/
translated: Rātri-gāragi.

original: krit la zhes pa rjes su 'jug bzhin pa la slar yang krit smos pa'i phyir gzhan la'ang ste krit min pa 'ga' zhig la'ang bya ba rnam par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: krit la zhes pa rjes su 'jug bzhin pa la slar yang krit smos pa'i phyir gzhan la'ang ste krit min pa 'ga' zhig la'ang bya ba rnam par shes par bya'o //
translated: The kṛta is in the process of being added, and kṛta is mentioned again, so it is to be known that the action is also in other [words] that are not kṛta.

original: des na ya la yang na'o zhes pas a'a nyid do //
analyzed: des na ya la yang na'o zhes pas a'a nyid do //
translated: Therefore, the ya sound is also na, and so it is ā.

original: dper na / pra kh'a ya /
analyzed: dper na / pra kh'a ya /
translated: For example, prakhāya.

original: pra kha n+ya /
analyzed: pra kha n+ya /
translated: Prakhaṇya.

original: zhes pa la sogs pa la 'gyur ba de bzhin du /🔽kh'a pa te /
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa la 'gyur ba de bzhin du / kh'a pa te /
translated: In this way, the change is like that.🔽Khāpate.

original: kha n+ya te /
analyzed: kha n+ya te /
translated: Khanvate.

original: zhes pa la sogs pa yang ngo //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa yang ngo //
translated: and so on.

original: pu ram da ra b'a tsam ya ma sarbam ha dvisham ta pa rnams kyang ngo //
analyzed: pu ram da ra b'a tsam ya ma sarbam ha dvisham ta pa rnams kyang ngo //

analyzed: sgra 'di rnams ni p'a tar byas pa ste grub pa nyid kyis bshad par bya'o zhes pa'i don to //

analyzed: puranda ra;/ dri 'jigs pa la'o //

analyzed: 'jigs pa la rab tu sbyor ro zhes aina'o //

analyzed: grong 'joms par byed du 'jug go zhes pa ni puranda ra ste / las la aana'o //

analyzed: k'a ri ta dbyi'o //

analyzed: tshig snga ma'i aam a'a ga ma tshig prad du byas pa ste / byings kyi'ang thung ngu'o //

analyzed: b'a tsam ya ma:/

analyzed: ring por mi 'gyur ba tshig tu byas pa ste /🔽aa ma a'a ga ma la'ang ngo //

analyzed: byed pa po gcig dag gi zhes pas dngos po'i don la ktva'o //

analyzed: @257b tshig sdud las 'byung ba la zhes pas yap tu bsgyur ro //
translated: The word from a compound means that the yā suffix is added.

analyzed: pa yig ni 'di'i don no // 'o na pa rjes su 'brel pa'i krit kyis byings 'phangs pa de'i phyir /
translated: The letter pa is the meaning of this.

original: byings smos pa don med do zhe na /
analyzed: byings smos pa don med do zhe na /
translated: If one says, Because the kṛt suffix that is related to pa is indicated by the root, therefore the mention of the root is meaningless,

original: de ni yang dag pa min te /
analyzed: de ni yang dag pa min te /
translated: that is not correct.

original: nye ba'i tshig gi skabs yin pa nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: nye ba'i tshig gi skabs yin pa nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Because it is the section on secondary words.

original: nye ba'i tshig thung ngu'i mtha' can gyi'ang pa rjes su 'brel pa'i krit yod na /
analyzed: nye ba'i tshig thung ngu'i mtha' can gyi'ang pa rjes su 'brel pa'i krit yod na /
translated: If there is a kṛt suffix that is related to pa, which has a short secondary word at the end,

original: ta yig a'a ga ma srid par 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: ta yig a'a ga ma srid par 'gyur bas so //
translated: the letter ta would be possible after it.

original: gram ni / grong 'dren par byed do zhes pa kvipa'o //
analyzed: gram ni / grong 'dren par byed do zhes pa kvipa'o //
translated: The word grāma means to lead to a village, and is the root kvip.

original: thung ngu'i mtha' zhes pa ci zhe na /🔽a'a n'i ya /
analyzed: thung ngu'i mtha' zhes pa ci zhe na / a'a n'i ya /
translated: What is meant by at the end of a short vowel?

original: n'inya thob pa la'o //
analyzed: n'inya thob pa la'o //
translated: The word anīyā means to obtain.

original: a'ang snga ma'o //
analyzed: a'ang snga ma'o //
translated: The word ā is the previous [letter].

original: snga ma bzhin du kta'i rkyen te /
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du kta'i rkyen te /
translated: The condition of kta is as before, and

original: de'i yapa'o // pa rjes su 'brel pa zhes pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: de'i yapa'o // pa rjes su 'brel pa zhes pa ci zhe na /
translated: its yā is pa. What is meant by related to pa?

original: kri ta:/ mtha' smos pa ni rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i don to //
analyzed: kri ta:/ mtha' smos pa ni rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i don to //
translated: The mention of the end has the meaning of various kinds.

original: thung ngu smos pa bzhin du re yang rjes su 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thung ngu smos pa bzhin du re yang rjes su 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: Like the mention of the short, the long also applies.

original: aot aoot dag las kri ta'i ya dbyangs bzhin no //
analyzed: aot aoot dag las kri ta'i ya dbyangs bzhin no //
translated: From o and o, like the ya vowel of kṛt.

original: krit ya ni krit kyi yi'o //
analyzed: krit ya ni krit kyi yi'o //
translated: Kṛtya is the ya of kṛt.

original: ao yig dang aoo yig las pha rol gyi krit kyi rkyen dang 'brel pa'i ya yig ni dbyangs dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ao yig dang aoo yig las pha rol gyi krit kyi rkyen dang 'brel pa'i ya yig ni dbyangs dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro //
translated: From the letters o and o, the ya letter connected with the condition of the other kṛt becomes like a vowel.🔽Ha byam

original: ha byam / la byam /
analyzed: ha byam / la byam /
translated: Lab byam

original: hu sbyin pa la'o ;
analyzed: hu sbyin pa la'o ;
translated: Hu is for giving.

original: / lunya gcod pa la'o //
analyzed: / lunya gcod pa la'o //
translated: Lun is for cutting.

original: sbyin sreg sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: sbyin sreg sbyin par bya'o //
translated: Homa is to be given.🔽It is to be cut.🔽From the letter u, there is ava.

original: gcad par bya zhes pas au'i yi ge las gdon mi za ba de ba'o zhes pas dbyangs la ya'o //
analyzed: gcad par bya zhes pas au'i yi ge las gdon mi za ba de ba'o zhes pas dbyangs la ya'o //
translated: From the letter ya, there is the vowel.

original: yon tan no //
analyzed: yon tan no //
translated: It is a quality.

original: dbyangs bzhin 'gyur ba'i phyir aa war bsgyur ba'o //🔽aa ba sya l'a byam /
analyzed: dbyangs bzhin 'gyur ba'i phyir aa war bsgyur ba'o // aa ba sya l'a byam /
translated: Because it becomes like a vowel, it is changed to a.🔽Ava syala byam

original: aa ba sya bha byam /
analyzed: aa ba sya bha byam /
translated: Ava syabha byam

original: gdon mi za bar gcad par bya'o //
analyzed: gdon mi za bar gcad par bya'o //
translated: It is to be cut without doubt.

original: gdon mi za bar 'byung bar bya'o zhes pas au'i yi ge las gdon mi za ba la'o zhes pas ghyana'o //
analyzed: gdon mi za bar 'byung bar bya'o zhes pas au'i yi ge las gdon mi za ba la'o zhes pas ghyana'o //
translated: The syllable u is for undoubtedly, and the syllable gha is for undoubtedly.

original: 'phel ba'o // dbyangs bzhin du 'gyur ba'i phyir a'a wa'o //
analyzed: 'phel ba'o // dbyangs bzhin du 'gyur ba'i phyir a'a wa'o //
translated: It is increasing, and the syllable ā is for like a melody.

original: aa ba shyama'i bshad par bya ba las ma yig dbyi'o //
analyzed: aa ba shyama'i bshad par bya ba las ma yig dbyi'o //
translated: The syllable ma is for not, and the syllable a is for not.

original: aot dang aoo ta dag las zhes pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: aot dang aoo ta dag las zhes pa ci zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of the syllables o and au?

original: tsa ya:/ tsi nya sogs pa la'o //
analyzed: tsa ya:/ tsi nya sogs pa la'o //
translated: The syllable ya is for ca, and the syllable ci is for ca, and so on.

original: dbyangs las ya'o //
analyzed: dbyangs las ya'o //
translated: The syllable ya is for melody.

original: yon tan no //
analyzed: yon tan no //
translated: It is quality, and the syllable kṛt is for quality.

original: krit smos pa ci zhe na /🔽au po ya te /
analyzed: krit smos pa ci zhe na / au po ya te /
translated: What is the meaning of the syllable u?

original: be nya skud pa'i rgyud la'o //
analyzed: be nya skud pa'i rgyud la'o //
translated: The syllable u is for upaya, and the syllable ya is for upaya.

original: au pa snga ma'o //
analyzed: au pa snga ma'o //
translated: The syllable u is for before, and the syllable ya is for before.

original: byings thams cad pa la yana'o //
analyzed: byings thams cad pa la yana'o //
translated: The syllable ya is for all roots.

original: sva pi ba tsa zhes pas sam pra s'a ra na'o //
analyzed: sva pi ba tsa zhes pas sam pra s'a ra na'o //
translated: The syllable sa is for samprāśa, and the syllable ra is for samprāśa.

original: n'a mi'i mtha' rnams kyi yan a'a yi zhes pas ring po'o //
analyzed: n'a mi'i mtha' rnams kyi yan a'a yi zhes pas ring po'o //
translated: The syllable ya is for long at the end of all names.

original: au'i yi ge la ao'o //🔽dzikshi ngag gi nus pa la'o //
analyzed: au'i yi ge la ao'o // dzikshi ngag gi nus pa la'o //
translated: The syllable o is for the syllable u.

original: dzi rgyal ba la'o //
analyzed: dzi rgyal ba la'o //
translated: The syllable kṣi is for speech, and the syllable jikṣi is for speech.🔽 The syllable ji is for conqueror, and the syllable kṣi is for exhaustion.

original: kshi zad pa la'o zhes pa 'di dag gi nus pa'i don la krita'i ya yig dbyangs bzhin du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kshi zad pa la'o zhes pa 'di dag gi nus pa'i don la krita'i ya yig dbyangs bzhin du 'gyur ro //
translated: The syllable ya of kṛt changes like a melody in the meaning of the power of these.

original: dza y+ya:/ ksha y+ya:/
analyzed: dza y+ya:/ ksha y+ya:/
translated: JAH YAH

original: rgyal ba'i ched du nus par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyal ba'i ched du nus par bya'o //
translated: For the sake of victory.🔽 For the sake of exhaustion.

original: zad pa'i ched du nus par bya'o zhes pa dbyangs las ya'o //
analyzed: zad pa'i ched du nus par bya'o zhes pa dbyangs las ya'o //
translated: Thus, from the vowels, YAH.

original: yon tan no //
analyzed: yon tan no //
translated: Quality.🔽 A.

original: aa ya'o // nus pa la zhes pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: aa ya'o // nus pa la zhes pa ci zhe na /
translated: For the sake of power.🔽 ZO YAH.

analyzed: rgyal bar bya'o //

original: zad par bya'o// @258a * //
analyzed: zad par bya'o// @258a * //

original: zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: zhes pa'i don to //

analyzed: kr'inya las de'i don la'o //

analyzed: de'i don ni de'i don no //

analyzed: de zhes pas kr'inya la bsnyeg par bya'o //

analyzed: kra spyo goo:/ dbyangs las snga ma'o //

original: yon tan no //
analyzed: yon tan no //

analyzed: aa ya'o // de'i don la zhes pa ci zhe na / kre yo goo:/ rin gyis blang bar bya ba'i ba lang yod pa'ang ma yin la /

analyzed: zod med pa la yong pa'ang ma yin no zhes pas rdzas brje ba med do //

original: sbyar ba min pa'i bi'i dbyi'o //
analyzed: sbyar ba min pa'i bi'i dbyi'o //

original: krit smos pa sprel lo //
analyzed: krit smos pa sprel lo //

original: kvi pa la sogs pa'i rkyen rnams kyi rjes su 'brel pa rnams bsal nas ba yig tsam gang yin pa de 'dir gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: kvi pa la sogs pa'i rkyen rnams kyi rjes su 'brel pa rnams bsal nas ba yig tsam gang yin pa de 'dir gzung bar bya'o //

original: ai yig ni brjod pa'i don to //
analyzed: ai yig ni brjod pa'i don to //

analyzed: aagni tsit / me bsags par byed do zhes pa aagni las zi las so // zhes pas kvipa'o //

analyzed: rgyan gyi ched du sbyor ro zhes pas aina'o //

analyzed: stri bhu ba hi ba si zhes dzha'i rkyen no //

original: sta na ya tinu:/
analyzed: sta na ya tinu:/

original: stan gsal bar byed pa la'o //
analyzed: stan gsal bar byed pa la'o //

original: tsur sogs las kyang ngo zhes pas aina'o //
analyzed: tsur sogs las kyang ngo zhes pas aina'o //

translated: The in having the former ya becomes āya.

original: yab pha rol la'o //
analyzed: yab pha rol la'o //

original: pra sham spyar rab tu zhi ba'i ched du sbyor ro zhes pas aina'o //
analyzed: pra sham spyar rab tu zhi ba'i ched du sbyor ro zhes pas aina'o //

original: ring po'o // ma rjes su 'brel pa rnams kyi thung du'o //
analyzed: ring po'o // ma rjes su 'brel pa rnams kyi thung du'o //

original: byed pa po gcig pa zhes pas ktv'a'o //
analyzed: byed pa po gcig pa zhes pas ktv'a'o //

original: bsdu ba 'byung ba la zhes pas @259a * //
analyzed: bsdu ba 'byung ba la zhes pas @259a * //

analyzed: ya pa'o // de bzhin du pra nam sbya bi ga na spya ga ni'i tsur la sogs pa nyid kyi phyir aina'i mtha' can no //

analyzed: 'o na ain'i yang ba snga ma med de bar du chod pa'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: bden te / sbyor ba rtsom pa'i shugs las chod pa na'ang bya ba rnam par shes par bya'o //

original: yang ba snga ma'i zhes pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: yang ba snga ma'i zhes pa ci zhe na /

analyzed: bits'a rya / rnam par dpyad pa la rab tu sbyor ro //

original: zhes pas aina'o //
analyzed: zhes pas aina'o //

analyzed: kta'o // de'i ya ba'o //

translated: What is the meaning of the words “in the case of the mass of semen and contact”?

original: shya na:/ song ngo zhes pa'i don no //🔽snga ma bzhin du na nyid do //
analyzed: shya na:/ song ngo zhes pa'i don no // snga ma bzhin du na nyid do //
translated: The meaning of the word “gone” is “gone to the other side.”🔽The word “also” is as before.

original: pra ti las kyang ngo //
analyzed: pra ti las kyang ngo //
translated: The word “pratī” also means “in the case of.”

original: pra ti'i sgra las pha rol gyi shya ti nishtha pha rol la sam pra s'a ra nar 'gyur te /
analyzed: pra ti'i sgra las pha rol gyi shya ti nishtha pha rol la sam pra s'a ra nar 'gyur te /
translated: From the word “pratī” comes “pratīśīta” which means “gone to the other side.”

original: khu ba'i gong bu dang reg pa'i don min pa brjod pa'o //🔽pra ti sh'i na:/
analyzed: khu ba'i gong bu dang reg pa'i don min pa brjod pa'o // pra ti sh'i na:/
translated: It is said that it is not the meaning of “the mass of semen and contact.”🔽The word “pratīśīna” means “gone to the other side.”

original: pra ti sh'i na w'an /
analyzed: pra ti sh'i na w'an /
translated: The word “pratīśīnavān” means “having gone to the other side.”

original: aa bhi aa ba dag las yang na'o //
analyzed: aa bhi aa ba dag las yang na'o //
translated: The word “api” is from the words “abhi” and “ava.”🔽The words “abhi” and “ava” have the meaning of “gone to the other side.”

original: aa bhi dang aa ba zhes pa 'di dag la sa pha rol gyi shy'a ya ti'i nishth'a pha rol la yang na sam pra s'a ra na ru 'gyur ro //🔽aa bhi sh'i nam /
analyzed: aa bhi dang aa ba zhes pa 'di dag la sa pha rol gyi shy'a ya ti'i nishth'a pha rol la yang na sam pra s'a ra na ru 'gyur ro // aa bhi sh'i nam /
translated: The word “abhiśīna” means “gone to the other side.”🔽The word “abhiśīnavān” means “having gone to the other side.”

original: aa bhi sh'i nam /🔽aa ba shvi nam /🔽aa ba shy'a nam /
analyzed: aa bhi sh'i nam / aa ba shvi nam / aa ba shy'a nam /
translated: The word “avaśīna” means “gone to the other side.”🔽The word “avaśīnavān” means “having gone to the other side.”

original: yang na sam pra s'a ra na'o //
analyzed: yang na sam pra s'a ra na'o //
translated: The word “api” means “also.”

original: shye las reg pa min dang zhes pas na nyid do //
analyzed: shye las reg pa min dang zhes pas na nyid do //
translated: The word “śīna” means “not in contact.”

original: benya dzy'a dag gi ya pa la ma yin no //
analyzed: benya dzy'a dag gi ya pa la ma yin no //
translated: The word “bhenjayā” is not in the case of the first person.

original: benydzy'a zhes pa 'di dag gi ya ba pha rol la sam pra s'a ra nar 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: benydzy'a zhes pa 'di dag gi ya ba pha rol la sam pra s'a ra nar 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: The word banyā is not changed to samprāśaranar in the sense of the other side.

original: benya ni yadza la sogs pa nyid kyi phyir thob la /
analyzed: benya ni yadza la sogs pa nyid kyi phyir thob la /
translated: Banya is obtained because of yaj and so on.

original: dzy'ang gra ha la sogs pa nyid kyi phyir ro //🔽pra b'a ya /
analyzed: dzy'ang gra ha la sogs pa nyid kyi phyir ro // pra b'a ya /
translated: Jya is also because of graha and so on.🔽Pravāya.

original: pra dzy'a ya /
analyzed: pra dzy'a ya /
translated: Prajyayā.

original: bya'i 'ang ngo //
analyzed: bya'i 'ang ngo //
translated: And bya.

original: byenya zhes pa 'di'i ya pa pha rol la sam pra s'a ra nar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: byenya zhes pa 'di'i ya pa pha rol la sam pra s'a ra nar mi 'gyur te /
translated: The word banya is not changed to samprāśaranar in the sense of the other side.

original: ya dza la sogs pa nyid kyi phyir thob pa la /
analyzed: ya dza la sogs pa nyid kyi phyir thob pa la /
translated: It is obtained because of yaj and so on.

original: pra by'a ya /
analyzed: pra by'a ya /
translated: Pravyāya.

original: byenya sdom par byed pa la'o//
analyzed: byenya sdom par byed pa la'o//
translated: Banya is for binding.

original: sam pa ri dag las yang na'o //
analyzed: sam pa ri dag las yang na'o //
translated: From sam and pari, also.

analyzed: sam dang pa ri dag las pha rol byenya'i ya ba pha rol la sam pra s'a ra nar yang na mi 'gyur ro // sam b'i ya /
translated: From sam and pari, the other side banya is not changed to samprāśaranar in the sense of the other side.🔽Sambyāya.

original: sam by'a ya /🔽pa ri ba'i ya /
analyzed: sam by'a ya / pa ri ba'i ya /
translated: Samvyāya.🔽Paribyāya.

original: pa ri by'a ya /
analyzed: pa ri by'a ya /

analyzed: sam pra s'a ra na byas pa na mtha' ring po'o zhes pas ring po'o //

original: mtha' la yod pa ni mtha' la yod pa'o //
analyzed: mtha' la yod pa ni mtha' la yod pa'o //

analyzed: pra sh'an / pra t'a n'a /

analyzed: sha mu nye bar zhi ba la'o //

original: ta mu 'dod pa la'o ;
analyzed: ta mu 'dod pa la'o ;

original: // rab tu zhi bar byed do //
analyzed: // rab tu zhi bar byed do //

original: rab tu 'dod par byed do zhes pas kvipa'o //
analyzed: rab tu 'dod par byed do zhes pas kvipa'o //

original: 'dis ring po'o //
analyzed: 'dis ring po'o //

analyzed: byings kyi ma'i na'o zhes pas mtha'i na'o // sh'anta:/ sh'anta w'an /

original: t'anta:/ t'antab'an\/ zhi bar byed zin no //
analyzed: t'anta:/ t'antab'an\/ zhi bar byed zin no //

original: pakt'a / dhut la zhes pa ci zhe na /

original: gamya te / yana'o //

analyzed: yon tan med pa la zhes pa ci zhe na /

analyzed: aa pa ti las mtha' @261b dbyi ba'o zhes pas mna'o //

analyzed: de'i mtha'i dbyangs dang po dbyi'o //

analyzed: auta'o // yon tan no // ra las dbyi bar bya ba dag go //

analyzed: ra yig las pha rol gyi cha yig dang bi yig dag dbyi bar bya ba dag tu 'gyur te /

analyzed: kvipa dang dhuta yon tan med pa dang / lnga pa pha rol la'o //
translated: Kvipa, dhut, in the absence of a quality, and in the fifth, the final syllable.🔽Hū, dhū.

original: h'u:/ dh'u:/ hur tsha 'khyogs po la'o ;
analyzed: h'u:/ dh'u:/ hur tsha 'khyogs po la'o ;
translated: Hūṃ, in the case of a crooked person.

original: rhurb'i 'tshe ba la'o //
analyzed: rhurb'i 'tshe ba la'o //
translated: Rahva, in the case of an attack.

original: dngos po'i don la kvipa'o //
analyzed: dngos po'i don la kvipa'o //
translated: In the case of a real object, kvipa.

original: 'dis tsha dang bdag dbyi'o //
analyzed: 'dis tsha dang bdag dbyi'o //
translated: This is ūṇa.

original: air aur dag gi a'ir a'ur dag go //
analyzed: air aur dag gi a'ir a'ur dag go //
translated: The i of iir becomes ai, and the u of uir becomes au.🔽Hurn, dhurn.

original: h'ur nna:/ dh'urnna:/ byings dag brjod zin to //🔽a'ata rjes su 'brel pa las kyang ding shi zhes pa las kyang aid med do //
analyzed: h'ur nna:/ dh'urnna:/ byings dag brjod zin to // a'ata rjes su 'brel pa las kyang ding shi zhes pa las kyang aid med do //
translated: The roots have been explained.🔽After the affix, the i of ding is elided.

original: ba dang tsha dag dbyi bar byas pa nar las nishtha'i ta'i na te zhes pas na'o //
analyzed: ba dang tsha dag dbyi bar byas pa nar las nishtha'i ta'i na te zhes pas na'o //
translated: The i of ba and tsa is elided. The i of nar becomes na.

original: n'a mi'i ra ba dag la zhes pas ring po'o //
analyzed: n'a mi'i ra ba dag la zhes pas ring po'o //
translated: The i of na is elided.

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: Similarly,🔽murti, turti.

original: murtti:/ turtti:/ murtsha rmongs pa la'o //
analyzed: murtti:/ turtti:/ murtsha rmongs pa la'o //
translated: Murtsa means delusion.

original: turb'i 'tshe ba la'o //
analyzed: turb'i 'tshe ba la'o //
translated: Turva means harm.

original: bud med la kti'o //
analyzed: bud med la kti'o //
translated: Kat means woman.

original: sdam bzhin du ring po'o //
analyzed: sdam bzhin du ring po'o //
translated: The i of sam is elided.

original: hurm'a dhar+m'a mana\'i rkyena'o //
analyzed: hurm'a dhar+m'a mana\'i rkyena'o //
translated: Hurmadharmaman is the instrumental.

original: ba na ti ta no ti sogs aita bkag pa rnams kyi dhuta la lnga pa ste a'a ta'i aata 'ang ngo //
analyzed: ba na ti ta no ti sogs aita bkag pa rnams kyi dhuta la lnga pa ste a'a ta'i aata 'ang ngo //
translated: The five of dhut of the prohibited i of vanati, tanoti, etc. is at, and also at.

original: ta no ti gang rnams kyi dang po yin pa de rnams ni ta no ti la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: ta no ti gang rnams kyi dang po yin pa de rnams ni ta no ti la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: Those that have tan as the first are the tanoti, etc.

original: gang rnams la aita bkag pa de rnams aita bkag pa rnams so //
analyzed: gang rnams la aita bkag pa de rnams aita bkag pa rnams so //
translated: Those that have the prohibited i are the prohibited i.

original: de nas zlas dbye ba'o //
analyzed: de nas zlas dbye ba'o //
translated: Then the dvandva compound.

original: yon tan med pa smos pa sbrel bar bya'o //
analyzed: yon tan med pa smos pa sbrel bar bya'o //
translated: The absence of a good quality is to be added.

original: ban dang sha na gus pa la'o zhes pa 'di'i dang ta no ti la sogs pa rnams kyi dang / de bzhin du aita bkag ba rnams kyi lnga pa dbyi bar bya bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: ban dang sha na gus pa la'o zhes pa 'di'i dang ta no ti la sogs pa rnams kyi dang / de bzhin du aita bkag ba rnams kyi lnga pa dbyi bar bya bar 'gyur te /
translated: The words bhan and śana are for respect. The words ending in -noti and so on have the fifth vowel i, which is to be elided.

original: dhuta yon tan med pa pha rol la'o //
analyzed: dhuta yon tan med pa pha rol la'o //
translated: Dhūta is for the absence of a good quality in another.

original: aata'i aat'ang ste a'a yig gi'ang aa yig tu bsgyur ro //
analyzed: aata'i aat'ang ste a'a yig gi'ang aa yig tu bsgyur ro //
translated: The words aṭ and aṭ also are changed from a to ā.🔽Bati.

original: bti:/ banasha na'o //
analyzed: bti:/ banasha na'o //
translated: Bhan.

original: bud med la kti'o //
analyzed: bud med la kti'o //
translated: For a woman, kṛt.

original: sgra ldan dang ti dag la'ang krita'i zhes pas aita med do //
analyzed: sgra ldan dang ti dag la'ang krita'i zhes pas aita med do //
translated: Since it is said that “kṛt is for sound and ti,” there is no i.

original: phyis pa dang dbyangs bsgyur ba'i yongs su bshad pas lnga paphyis pa las snga ma'i lnga pa'i au pa dh'a ring po'o //
analyzed: phyis pa dang dbyangs bsgyur ba'i yongs su bshad pas lnga paphyis pa las snga ma'i lnga pa'i au pa dh'a ring po'o //
translated: Since the fifth vowel is elided and the vowel is changed, the long u of the previous is elided.

original: de nas 'dis lnga pa dbyi'o //
analyzed: de nas 'dis lnga pa dbyi'o //
translated: Then this fifth vowel is elided.

original: a'a yig gi aa gyig tu bsgyur ro //
analyzed: a'a yig gi aa gyig tu bsgyur ro //
translated: The ā is changed to ā.

original: gzhan du / ba ni las dh'uta dang po can la aita a'a ga ma yod do zhes 'di dper ma brjod do //
analyzed: gzhan du / ba ni las dh'uta dang po can la aita a'a ga ma yod do zhes 'di dper ma brjod do //
translated: Otherwise, it is said, “The i of the first dhūta is for action, and the ā that follows exists,” and this is not given as an example.

original: ta no ti sogs rnams kyi /
analyzed: ta no ti sogs rnams kyi /
translated: For ta-noti and so on,

original: ta ta:/ ta ta b'an /
analyzed: ta ta:/ ta ta b'an /

original: ksha ta b'a na /
analyzed: ksha ta b'a na /
translated: kṣatavān,

original: ta bu rgyas pa la'o //
analyzed: ta bu rgyas pa la'o //
translated: ta- to expand.

original: ksha nu 'tshe ba la'o //🔽rgyas par byas zin no //
analyzed: ksha nu 'tshe ba la'o // rgyas par byas zin no //
translated: kṣaṇu to harm.🔽Expanded.

original: rgyas par byed zin no //🔽'tshe bar byed zin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: rgyas par byed zin no // 'tshe bar byed zin no zhes pa'o //
translated: Expanded.🔽Harmed.

original: ding shvi zhes pas aita med do //🔽de bzhin du /
analyzed: ding shvi zhes pas aita med do // de bzhin du /
translated: The dhin-śva does not have ita.

original: ta ti:/ ksha ti:/
analyzed: ta ti:/ ksha ti:/
translated: In the same way,🔽tataḥ, kṣataḥ.

original: bud med la kti'o //🔽aita bkag pa rnams kyi /
analyzed: bud med la kti'o // aita bkag pa rnams kyi /
translated: In the feminine, katih.🔽The prohibited ones

original: ya ta:/ ra ta:/
analyzed: ya ta:/ ra ta:/
translated: yat, rat,

original: na ta:/ ga ta:/🔽sdom par byed zin no //
analyzed: na ta:/ ga ta:/ sdom par byed zin no //
translated: nat, gat.🔽Bound.🔽Played.🔽Bowed.

original: rtse bar byed zin no //🔽phyag byed @262a * //🔽zin no ; /'gro bar byed zin no zhes pa 'gro ba'i don dang las med pa zhes pas kta'o //🔽de bzhin du /
analyzed: rtse bar byed zin no // phyag byed @262a * // zin no ; /'gro bar byed zin no zhes pa 'gro ba'i don dang las med pa zhes pas kta'o // de bzhin du /

original: ya ti:/ na ti:/
analyzed: ya ti:/ na ti:/
translated: In the same way,🔽yatih, natiḥ,🔽gatih.

original: ga ti:/ lnga ba zhes pa ci zhe na /🔽bkva:/ 'tshed par byed zin no zhes pa ste tsa sde'i kvi'o //
analyzed: ga ti:/ lnga ba zhes pa ci zhe na / bkva:/ 'tshed par byed zin no zhes pa ste tsa sde'i kvi'o //

original: kshe shu tsi pa tsa rnams kyi ma ga bzhes pas ba nyid do //
analyzed: kshe shu tsi pa tsa rnams kyi ma ga bzhes pas ba nyid do //
translated: The kṣeṣu, ci, and pac are the same as ba by the rule of ma ga.

original: dhuta la zhes pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: dhuta la zhes pa ci zhe na /

original: ha n+ya te /
analyzed: ha n+ya te /

analyzed: yon tan med pa zhes pa ci zhe na / hanta / tri tsa\'o //

original: hanti las lnga pa dbyi bar 'dod de /
analyzed: hanti las lnga pa dbyi bar 'dod de /
translated: hanta is desired to be elided after the fifth case.

original: aa dya ta n'a'i a'atma ne'i tshig pha rol la'o //
analyzed: aa dya ta n'a'i a'atma ne'i tshig pha rol la'o //
translated: In the word ādyatanī of the Ātmanepada, it is after the other.

analyzed: a'a ha ta / a'a ha s'a t'am /

analyzed: a'a ha sa ta /

analyzed: hanti a'ang sngon ma can gyi ru tsa la sogs pa'o //

original: thung ngu las kyang aita med pa'i 'o zhes pas si tsa dbyi'o ;
analyzed: thung ngu las kyang aita med pa'i 'o zhes pas si tsa dbyi'o ;

original: / phra ma rtogs par bya ba la ya mi las kyang ngo //
analyzed: / phra ma rtogs par bya ba la ya mi las kyang ngo //

original: au d'a ya ta /
analyzed: au d'a ya ta /

original: ya mi a'ang sngon ma can ni ru tsa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ya mi a'ang sngon ma can ni ru tsa la sogs pa'o //

original: aadya ta n'i las si tsa'o //
analyzed: aadya ta n'i las si tsa'o //

original: snga ma bzhin du si tsa dbyi'o //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du si tsa dbyi'o //

original: phra ma byed zin no zhes pa'i don no //
analyzed: phra ma byed zin no zhes pa'i don no //

original: bag ma len pa rtogs par bya ba la ni rnam par brtag par bshad par bya'o //🔽au p'a yat kan+y'am /
analyzed: bag ma len pa rtogs par bya ba la ni rnam par brtag par bshad par bya'o // au p'a yat kan+y'am /
translated: In order to understand the marriage, it should be explained as an analysis.🔽upāyata kanyām

original: aup'a ya ta ka n+y'am /
analyzed: aup'a ya ta ka n+y'am /

original: aa dya ta n'i dang a'a sh'isha dag la'ang a'adma ne'i tshig las ga mi las lnga pa dbyi bar yang na 'dod do //🔽sa ma ga ta /
analyzed: aa dya ta n'i dang a'a sh'isha dag la'ang a'adma ne'i tshig las ga mi las lnga pa dbyi bar yang na 'dod do // sa ma ga ta /
translated: In the case of adhyayana and āśīṣa, the fifth is elided by the rule of adman.🔽samāgata

original: sa ma gam sta /
analyzed: sa ma gam sta /
translated: samāgamat

original: ga mi las sam sngon ma can ni ru tsa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ga mi las sam sngon ma can ni ru tsa la sogs pa'o //

original: si tsa dbyi ba snga ma bzhin no //🔽sam gi s'ashta /
analyzed: si tsa dbyi ba snga ma bzhin no // sam gi s'ashta /

original: sam gam s'ishta /🔽yab la 'ong /
analyzed: sam gam s'ishta / yab la 'ong /

analyzed: ba na ti dang ta no ti sogs dang aita bkag pa rnams kyi lnga dbyi bar 'gyur te ya pa pha rol la'o //
translated: The fifth is elided in the case of yāpa and tāna, etc., and the prohibition of ita.

original: pra ba tya /
analyzed: pra ba tya /
translated: pravartate

original: pra ta tya /
analyzed: pra ta tya /

analyzed: byed pa po gcig ces pa sa kta'o // tshig sdud la 'byung ba zhes pas yapa\'o //

analyzed: yap pha rol la'o // pra ya tya /

original: pra ya myi /🔽pra na tya /
analyzed: pra ya myi / pra na tya /

original: pra na mya /
analyzed: pra na mya /

original: ti ka la ring po'ang ma yin no //
analyzed: ti ka la ring po'ang ma yin no //
